title: "Somebody Spell Their Name Wrong": 2 Resume Red Flags, From A Recruiter

title: What Is 'Swatting'? Donald Trump's Cabinet Nominees Targeted With Threats
content: People who carry out a swatting prank call aim to fool emergency services into sending a Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) team to respond to the supposed emergency.
summary: People who carry out a swatting prank call aim to fool emergency services into sending a Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) team to respond to the supposed emergency.

title: Rare First Edition Harry Potter Book Auctioned For 36,000 Pounds
content: Nearly 30 years after being bought for just 10 pounds, a rare first edition of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone sold for 36,000 pounds at an auction on Wednesday.
summary: Nearly 30 years after being bought for just 10 pounds, a rare first edition of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone sold for 36,000 pounds at an auction on Wednesday.

title: Does Uniqlo Use Cotton From China's Xinjiang. What Top Boss Said
content: Uniqlo doesn't use cotton from China's Xinjiang region to make its products, Tadashi Yanai, the chief executive of Fast Retailing, the company behind the global fashion chain, has said.
summary: Uniqlo doesn't use cotton from China's Xinjiang region to make its products, Tadashi Yanai, the chief executive of Fast Retailing, the company behind the global fashion chain, has said.

title: Endangered Australian Cockatoo Among World's Longest-Living Birds
content: An endangered type of cockatoo found only in southwest Australia is among the longest-living bird species in the world, according to a new research.
summary: An endangered type of cockatoo found only in southwest Australia is among the longest-living bird species in the world, according to a new research.

title: Sunita Williams To Celebrate Thanksgiving In Space With This Special Meal
content: Indian-origin NASA astronaut Sunita Williams is set to celebrate Thanksgiving in space with smoked turkey, mashed potato'.
summary: Indian-origin NASA astronaut Sunita Williams is set to celebrate Thanksgiving in space with smoked turkey, mashed potato'.

title: After Years Of Strained Ties, Mark Zuckerberg Dines With Trump At Mar-a-Lago
content: Mark Zuckerberg joined Donald Trump for dinner at his Mar-a-Lago estate Wednesday, with an advisor to the president-elect saying the tech billionaire "wants to support the national renewal of America."
summary: Mark Zuckerberg joined Donald Trump for dinner at his Mar-a-Lago estate Wednesday, with an advisor to the president-elect saying the tech billionaire "wants to support the national renewal of America."

title: Microsoft Faces Broad Antitrust Investigation From US Federal Trade Commission
content: The US Federal Trade Commission has opened an antitrust investigation of Microsoft Corporation, drilling into everything from the company's cloud computing and software licensing businesses to cybersecurity offerings and AI products.
summary: The US Federal Trade Commission has opened an antitrust investigation of Microsoft Corporation, drilling into everything from the company's cloud computing and software licensing businesses to cybersecurity offerings and AI products.

title: 1,000 Arrests, A Jailed Former PM: Pakistan's Political Turmoil Explained
content: The standoff between the Pakistani government and the supporters of former Prime Minister Imran Khan has reached a boiling point. With deadly clashes, sweeping arrests, and widespread discontent, Pakistan once again faces political turmoil.
summary: The standoff between the Pakistani government and the supporters of former Prime Minister Imran Khan has reached a boiling point. With deadly clashes, sweeping arrests, and widespread discontent, Pakistan once again faces political turmoil.

title: Taylor Swift Named No 2 Greatest Pop Star Of The 21st Century By Billboard

title: "Our Outlook Remains Unchanged": Abu Dhabi's IHC On Adani Group Investments

title: War-Hit Ukraine Sees Influx Of Western War Tourists

title: Post Trump Victory, US Families Ditch Thanksgiving Reunions

title: 1.5 Million Deaths A Year Linked To Air Pollution From Fires: Study
content: Over 90 percent of deaths linked to air pollution from landscape fires were in low and middle-income countries, with nearly 40 percent in sub-Saharan Africa alone.
summary: Over 90 percent of deaths linked to air pollution from landscape fires were in low and middle-income countries, with nearly 40 percent in sub-Saharan Africa alone.

title: "When Will American Overreach Stop": Norway Diplomat On Adani Case
content: Norwegian diplomat and former UN Environment Programme Executive Director Erik Solheim has questioned the US government report on the Adani Group, calling it a case of "American overreach."
